qas.question: What is it called when there is greater than 30 percent reduction in hatchability of eggs?
What can reduce the negative effects of inbreeding?

answers.text: Females paired with related males may undertake extra pair matings

qas.question: What percentage of broods produced by incestuously paired females contained extra pair of young?

context: Incestuous matings by the purple-crowned fairy wren Malurus coronatus result in severe fitness costs due to <a0_0>inbreeding depression<a0_0/> (greater than 30% reduction in hatchability of eggs). <a1_0>Females paired with related males may undertake extra pair matings<a1_0/> (see Promiscuity#Other animals for 90% frequency in avian species) that can reduce the negative effects of inbreeding. However, there are ecological and demographic constraints on extra pair matings. Nevertheless, <a2_0>43%<a2_0/> of broods produced by incestuously paired females contained extra pair young.
